Description: Fragments from the hem area of a woollen, weft-faced plain weave tunic; Cream, undyed wool with contrasting tapestry (single warp threads) ornaments of squares and bars forming right angles in dark blue and cream wool; Wrapped float brocading; Remains of fringe from hem, itself with ornaments, decoration is geometrical, based on little lozenges and mainly arranged in rectangles, with medallions at the centre of squares, finishing bars, outer border of trefoils; Also includes patches on the main fabric; Warp: S spun, c.11 tpc; Weft: S spun, broacading weft Z spin, c.50 tpc; Edges: mostly ragged, remains of main selvedge with fringe, subsidiary internal selvedges and closing cord with plait from sides, twining across top and bottom of internal selvedgres; Sewing: S spun Z ply wool thread, overcasting cloasing internal selvedges, overcasting and running stitches attaching patches; Patches cut from a textile similar to the main tunic, weft-faced plain weave, undyed/cream wool, warp: S spun / c.10 ptc, weft: S spun / c.45-50 tpc, edges cut and tuned under, others ragged; Nine other fragments stored separately.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, brown box (two accetate envelopes); V. well worn before burial; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (1/11/1989)
Condition: Poor; worn and fragmentary; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
